reviews.text:
The food was great and service was fast.
I like their classic diner-like atmosphere.  I would highly recommend this place. We got apple cider pancakes and their tomato soup with grilled cheese sandwich. The milkshake were very good and a great deal. The Irish coffee was also excellent and would recommend to warm up with during winter.

I’d give it 3.5/5. Some of the food was good, some was on the level of Waffle House. Our server had a lot of energy on a Sunday at 2:30, but we had to get up for our own silverware after we got the food. Same with ketchup, etc. My order was wrong. The servers were making their own drinks and loudly joking amongst themselves while the service was lacking. And the hostess was at a table eating out in the front. Doesn’t seem like the most professional staff. Strange vibe. The ahi tuna sandwich was good. Avoid the TUBS dish and the sangria. All sugar, no alcohol.

The food was excellent, although the corned beef hash was extremely salty. I loved the smoked salmon rangoons, and thought it was the highlight of the meal. The biscuits and gravy were also stellar too, and that dish was HUGE. I enjoyed the banana cream pie, but thought the crust was too thick. The only downside was that the place was a bit too loud music-wise and our server seemed disinterested in serving us

Amazing ambiance. I love the vibe there. Family friendly but also very chill. We got the short rib roast dinner. It was so tender and flavorful. The mashed potatoes were super creamy. Great carrots.

Carrot cake was yummy and enormous. Just a bit dry. Huge fan and planning to come for breakfast.

They open early, this is a huge plus. Parking was easy and it wasn’t crowded so we were seated immediately. Our server, Karen was far from what you would think of when you hear Karen. Very polite, attentive, helpful, and professional. Our food was served quick and she even complimented our looks, huge plus. I have no complaints, the food was delicious and I appreciated the pleasant experience.

I went to matchbox with a group of 10 people for a happy hour after a tour. Their happy hour menu was really good but most of us ended up getting Hot Tea because it was so cold outside. We try almost the entire happy hour menu (except for drink). My personal favorite was the chicken bites. Our host was awesome. He had great energy and got all of our orders correct. I was supposed by how big the restaurant was. There is a ton of space.

Disappointed with management. We went for a bite and drinks before a comedy show. We ordered a beer, a cocktail and a small pizza. All we’re on the happy hour menu.

We got the check and it was all full price. We asked our server about the happy hour price. The manager told him that we would have had to request the happy hour price when we ordered…

I’m just confused because the menus we were given have the happy hour deal right there.

Always enjoy eating here; they have one of the best happy hour menus in the District (DMV) area. The food was great and so was our waiter, my friend and I ordered the Matchbox Meat Pizza, the honey wings and fried risotto.
Only negative I will say is that we pretty much had to seat ourselves the staff were sitting together chatting and laughing at a table. Though I was staying at the entrance no one came to sit us. I had to go to the bartender thinking since it’s happy hour the bar is where we will order. He said no and walked over to his co workers to let them know to assist us. Other than that we had a great time and food.
Had such a great time here! The food was delicious, and the bottomless mimosas had me feeling REAL fine! Great friendly service, and a clean, well run establishment! Highly recommend!!

I hadn’t been here in quite some time but I’m glad I went back. Had the fried chicken sandwich and it was delicious! Large chicken breast, deep fried, and tossed in Buffalo sauce. I had it with just the cabbage on top, and with fries.

Went in on Christmas Eve and it wasn’t busy, service was great, and it was an overall great vibe. I’ll definitely be going back.

Had a great brunch here! Everything was delicious. I was pleasantly surprised how good the pulled pork was in the cornbread waffle entree. The restaurant itself is very cute and has indoor and outdoor seating. Service was great - the food came out very quickly. Would definitely go back.

The food at this restaurant was so delicious, well beyond my expectations. Everyone at my table ordered seconds because it was so good. The champagne with our mimosas was also very nice. The service was a bit slow, but it was busy at brunch on a Saturday and we weren't exactly in a hurry to go. We sat outside and greatly enjoyed that, but inside the restaurant is beautiful, as well. Overall, I highly recommend giving this place a try, especially if you enjoy waffles!

Not good!
Pros: chef walked around and said hi to people which was nice. The design of their food is nice and well presented.
Our waiter had attitude! We purchased sparkling water then staff pour tab water on top of it! I ordered medium steak came in as a rare maybe medium rare, I asked just a little more cooked, after another 20 minutes came back as well-well done! We were part of 5, they were all done with their food so i didn’t say anything because was late at that point and wanted to get desert! At the end the check came in with 2% surcharges and 20% for such bad experience!

I have eaten here more than two dozen times mostly though it’s become my weekend early breakfast routine. I’ve had 80% of the breakfast/brunch menu items & am never disappointed. The waffles are amazing ( what you’d expect from a Belgium restaurant), the mushroom toast is so well seasoned snd a delight. The green eggs a really nice twist & I could go on… I loved the poached eggs with salmon and if you’re looking for traditional American
you can get it there too. I’ve also had the Flemish stew and mussels. The stew is extremely flavorful (a top notch culinary experience) and who can go wrong with a mussels in a white wine, garlic butter sauce with plenty of herbs to add the “wow” to the flavor. I am not a drinker but I did enjoy a really nice glass of Cabernet with the stew and it was an incredible match. They have a wide selection of wines. Overall if your looking for wonderful food experience, you’ll have it here. The service is also always great and Omar is my go to server. He adds a nice mix of professionalism/home style treatment. Amongst the best DC spots!

Lovely restaurant, very cozy rooftop brunch destination. I was super impressed by the buttermilk fried chicken and waffle. It screams aesthetics.

Four stars because the servers weren't super friendly. We made a reservation ahead of time for our one year anniversary brunch, but we had to be squeezed in and seated at the bar upon arrival. Overall amazing food, so I would still come back!

Boutique beer garden, nice space and quick service. Unexpectedly walked in on a rainy Friday and was pleasantly surprised. Definitely recommend it for having a beer in a more informal setting.

The place is very nice, with wide industrial interior design. It’s located in a walkable neighborhood surrounded by relatively new buildings.

Finally, it offers a wide variety of local beer, tasty American cuisine, many televisions to broadcast your favorite sports and you can order through your phone.

We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner just 2 of us on a Saturday at 4:30. We were lucky to have a table open upstairs and sat immediately.  They have QR codes at each table - you order and pay and tip all online.  Each QR is unique to each table and the servers bring out the food. We ordered the pastrami sandwich with fries and the shredded pork sub tots. The food came out quickly and hot.  The pastrami was great and so was the shredded pork. The tots were “weird “. I think they were fried squares of mashed potatoes.  The place was bustling and full. The bathrooms needed attention.

Stopped by before the Nationals game against the Atlanta Braves for some good beer. This place doesn’t disappoint… there is a wide variety of beautiful local craft beer. I had the DIPA Rainbow and it was awesome. Even though we didn’t get food … I wish we did because it looked so good. Friendly staff … but even better beer. I wish i could have taken a 4 pack into the game!!!!

I love this place. I will be back and back again. Drinks are good. House beers are very good. Strawberry Sky on a hot July day is a great cure for DC muggy heat.
Price is better than Georgetown.
Enjoy
(Look a Walgreens flag).

Food is delicious! We ate outside. They offer indoor and outdoor seating. We didn’t love the service, mainly because they use a QR code for the menu and you pay for your food in advance. Some people love that, but it felt like ordering carry out and getting it served to you at the table. Eventually, a server came and brought us hard copies of the menu and took our order. The ladies’ bathroom needed attention. I would go back again because the food was great and it could’ve been a tough night in terms of the restrooms.

Very good Balkan restaurant. It is $50 per person for all you can eat of their so many but small dishes. I loved the size of their dishes. It was enough to just taste and order it again if you like it.  You can also pay $25 per person for unlimited drink or/and $8 for dessert. It is on a crowded street near the Capitol hill and Easter Market so maybe finding the parking is a bit of challenge specially over the weekend. The service could be a little better. We had to wait and even call the waiter when we needed something. Overall, a very good restaurant with unique experience that I'd highly recommend.

We love this restaurant and have been there three times already. Their selections and venues are great. We go for all inclusive menu for food and drink and we enjoy the inside and outside dining area. They would be able to speed up their preparation time since sometime it take a bit longer than usual but you still have some other food to bite on till they bring the next order because we order one extra portion anytime since we know the next portion takes longer so we have something to be busy working on it (although it may get cold sometime but better than waiting for your next meal to be prepared and show up on your table)
Hope you enjoy your time there and like their food and atmosphere

10/10 recommend Ambar!! The unlimited brunch is incredibly worth it. I tried as many things as I could before I was too full but the small plates help that! Starting with the spreads is perfect - a few different flavors and they were all so good. Then I had the tomato soup and the mini burger which were perfect if you’re looking for some lunch food. The grilled steak was my favorite dish for sure. Cooked perfectly and the flavor was phenomenal. I also had the potatoes hash and the strawberry waffle - a perfect way to end the meal! I cannot wait to go back.

Dining here for brunch was an experience. The ambiance and acoustics were grating and loud— it was difficult to hear speech from the waiter or from the table. The food was good, but not amazing. Nothing came out piping hot except the kebabs; everything was either cold or luke warm, including the veal soup. The Benedict dishes were soggy and watery from the poached egg. The favorite parts of the meal were the Balkan cheese and the waffles. It was nice that we could try as much as we wanted and we definitely left stuffed. The service was excellent and the staff were quick to remove empty dishes and ask if we wanted to order anything else. Perhaps the experience would be different at dinner; maybe it was exceptionally loud because of the unlimited drinks being served.

Great experience with all you can eat. Wide variation of items for selection and each item is like tapas style. Also each dish is decorated well and seasoned elegantly. If you come with a group, I'd recommend you try out as many dishes as you want as the portion size isn't too big.

Also note that the service can be slow as they get busier and sometimes items you order may not come until you almost forget about them. Other than that, I think this place is worth a visit and definitely worth the price.

I can’t believe I haven’t reviewed this on Google Maps. This is one of my favorite breakfast places in Washington. Tommy has been running this place for decades. They’re famous for their pancakes “blues“ and “blue bucks“ – but there’s so much more. Try their Brick sandwich (egg, cheese, bacon, potatoes on a bun), crab cakes, shrimp and grits, etc. Everything here is delicious. There used to be an hour wait in line on Saturday mornings. Since the pandemic, the lines have been shorter. This is a genuine DC hangout for locals. You will see a diverse crowd here – like you see on Capitol Hill in general. It makes me proud to live here. Long live Market Lunch!

the blueberry buckwheat pancakes were great. i usually go for french toast (my husband did) and I was happy I went with the pancakes. super moist and great taste. the french toast itself was just okay, but the apple cider syrup and cinnamon butter was pretty amazing. not a bad choice by any means. there was a line when we got there but it went quickly and seats freed up easily. loved the vibe !!
Holy yum! The crab cake sandwich was amazing. Super crispy outside. Great flavor. Fresh corn salad was yummy. Highly recommended

Had a great time and nice lunch at The Market Lunch after a short time browsing around the street market just outside on a Saturday.

The Market Lunch offered a wide array of breakfast and lunch foods. The line was pretty long, though this is no surprise given the quality of the food we received. We were waiting for approximately 30 minutes before placing our order, but only a further 5 to receive what we requested. Some of the menu items were no longer available due to high demand, specifically the soft crab, but nothing else appeared to be out of stock.

The food itself was delicious and made for a mostly filling lunch. The prices were a little high for a simple pair of fish sandwiches (rockfish & flounder) as well as a side of fries, but it's an easy matter to reconcile.

The place was heaving given the large queues but we didn't struggle to find a place to sit. It appears that the line moves slow enough for other customers to be finished with their meal by the time you are served.

I'd recommend visiting this place on a quiter day. While you're here, you can always browse what else is on offer in the Eastern Market.

In town for a wedding and had some time during the day to explore the town. Found the Market Lunch and damn glad we did. Food was delicious. Even though the place was jammed (hit it just before noon) the staff was really upbeat and pleasant and kept the line moving and the service prompt.

I've been coming here since I was a kid and I've always loved the subs here. I'm 51 years old and the subs are still amazing 🤩🤩🤩!!! This shrimp 🦐 salad sub, on a soft roll hit the spot. Outstanding oatmeal cookies not shown but, delicious as well.

Good neighborhood deli with a great staff. A good size menu with plenty of selections with great rolls both hard and soft. The only downside here is that it's right across from Eastern Market so parking and traffic can be problematic.

I had the Turkey sandwich. Which Was tasty the roll was soft staff was nice. I deducted one star because I don’t understand why sandwich shops here don’t carry side like basic potato salad or Mac salad .
Awesome little deli right across from competition in Eastern Market. Got the #1 and it was gigantic with nice soft bread.

I live right down the street from this place so it's my go-to spot for picking up lunch during the work day. They're known for their delicous sandwiches--I'd say I've tried at least 6 different ones and they've all been excellent. Generous portions, fresh ingredients, crafted with care. I also order a soup and salad pretty regularly--all of their soups are delicious (my go-to is the Maryland Crab and I love it...there isn't a lot of crabmeat but the flavor is on point), and the salads are fresh and just the right size! Love this place!

This was our first time at a Michelin star restaurant and it was the most delicious and romantic dinner I’ve ever had. My husband and I went for my birthday dinner and it was so special.  Our waiter, Ramsey, made the experience so personal and he was amazing! This was hands down the best service I’ve ever received at a restaurant from the moment we walked in until we left. Since it was my birthday, we were given a gift of a recipe and the ingredients we can make at home, as well as a raspberry tart with a candle!   I’m incredibly impressed and will be returning. 10/10 recommend. Also, for the meal and service we received it was so worth the money and very reasonably price.

Wonderful dinner with old friends. For each person, you order two savory items. Since we were a group of 4, we tried everything plus two desserts and a bottle of wine. We loved our meal! It was also a belated birthday celebration and the singing, swirling candle holder was a wonderful surprise. I would love to attempt to replicate some of those dishes.

Amazing experience! All the food was delicious! We had 4 people and got one one of each dish. We were given a gift of the "Strawberry Spaghetti", which to be honest if I saw it on the menu I wouldn't order but it was one of the best dishes I had. My personal favorite was the Asian- Italian fusion spaghetti. My dessert was the Vietnamese Coffee Caramel Coconut Crumble Mochi Brown Butter Cake (I am in desperate need of this recipe, so good!). The service was amazing and all of the servers were so knowledgeable about what they were serving. It's definitely a great place to impress someone.

Enjoyed all of the menus we ordered. Rose’s Luxury is a smart creative restaurant- not using any unheard or arcane ingredients or recipe, it effortlessly creates a new combination of tastes. The way it’s priced is hard to understand ($85 per person prefix for dinner regardless of what you order) and may make it relatively more expensive for some combination of dishes. Other than that, food and service was fantastic.

I did the solo option, was kinda worried going into it. Host and waiter were kind and explained options. I went with the chef's choice tasting menu. Would recommend that option if going single. Got to try a bunch of things i wouldn't have otherwise and enjoyed it all. Staff was talkative and answered all questions I had. And seeing what they do in the kitchen from the chef's table was cool. Everything exceeded expectations and I would recommend it for anyone in the area or visiting. I would visit again!

Tacos were so good, First time eating in DC and I gotta say this taco place is awesome, good food and the employees were very nice. I had chicken tacos and my daughter had a chicken quesadilla in which she ate it all and normally she dont so she loved it too. If you’re in DC check them out

I guess you get what you pay for. I chose for the 3 tacos option and the portions were quite small and almost no filling in it.*
Flavour wise, it was ok.

*I took a bite before opening the taco, that’s when I realised there was almost no filling in it and therefore took the photo.

District Taco used to be a respected restaurant here in Capital Hill, but in the recent years it has really fallen down from its former grace. They used to have a really nice self serf salsa bar. Now all they have are a limited amount of options that they charge you for. Another one of the joys of going there was the incredible sodas they had. It was all hand made pure cane sugar Boylan Soda, now they replaced it with a more modern machine with only big name sodas like Coke. The food has always been excellent although recently they changed their menu and raised the prices, got rid of a bunch of options on the menu and got rid of the kids menu. The food is still good and always arrives quickly. The service takes the form of fast food, although don't get me wrong the food is still quite tasty. Even though the prices have gone up the quantity of the stuff in the tacos have gone down. I know that a lot of places had to change the way they did things to adapt to the pandemic but this goes beyond that.

Great food. Really small portions though given you’re paying more than chipotle for basically the same thing, which seems cheap given rice costs like 2 cents a scoop. Hard to justify paying $12+ for a small scoop of rice and beans, and a tiny amount of chicken.

First time here, pretty disappointed.

Ordering: you order by a computer system that is fine but items you are searching for are not properly categorized so it makes it rather difficult to navigate and find the items that you were looking for if you’ve never been there before.

Post Ordering: once I placed my order and paid, sit down and didn’t realize that no one gave me my cups or my drink so I walked back over to pick up my cups and a young lady appeared asking me to show my receipt and proof of purchase to pick up my cup, she was not there to advise me to take my cup but when I walked back over to pick up a cup she magically appeared.

Wait; it was Cinco de Mayo so there was a pretty nice amount of wait time but it was no worries I was with a friend and we were chatting up, there was a ton of pick up in to go order so there was a lot of traffic in and out.

Food; I ordered the fish taco deluxe, extremely disappointed the fish was dry and not great. I would’ve been more happy with just a veggie taco. I also had the rice and beans which were amazing the rice was really good and the beans were delicious. I also ordered the guacamole and chips. The guacamole was phenomenal and the chips were fresh, and the salsa was really good.

Disappointment: I realize once I left which I live in Baltimore that they did not put my churros x3 in the bag and there was no way I was driving back to DC to get them, super disappointing.

Overall I would visit again, I would not order the fish tacos. I would try something different the salsa and guacamole was amazing. service was subpar, Restaurant was Decor was ok. No one  cleaned the tables in between Guest but I walk with my own alcohol so I cleaned my own table.

This location is trash. They do not honor free pizza at carry out when I waited over 20 minutes for a pick up order. I have had enough of their lack of communication. A deliver driver I apologized for the delay of my pick up order and placed a free pizza in the system for my next pick up. Today would be my next pick up, but of course it was not in the system. If you say you’re going to do something dominoes do it. If you can’t, just say you can’t.

Food was good, but it took 1.5 hours to get my order, which was well over the 45-55 minute estimated timeframe. I was hosting my husband’s coworkers and they were left hungry for an abnormal amount of time, leaving me embarrassed. I tried calling the store multiple times to check-in on my order and they would not answer the phone. I also tried using the contact center, to no avail.

It is clear that both timing and communication have been consistent issues with this location previously and that management has done nothing to address these problem areas. Save your money – or spend it at a business that takes pride in serving its customers.

We ordered in many days in advance for a big community event and on the day of the event when we called to ensure the order was on the way, we were told there was no record of the order. We kept calling to doublecheck, but no one would answer the phone. It was over $200.  Dominoes ended up arriving 40 minutes late, but they did arrive. I feel terrible because we weren't expecting it so we didn't have money to tip the delivery guy who was quite nice. Meanwhile, we had ordered from a competitor who arrived minutes later. So we broke our budget but at least we had the pizza promised to our residents. Dominoes never apologized, never offered a credit, a coupon or even an acknowledgement that they messed up. Love the pizza but the ordeal was very stressful. Tell the delivery guy sorry or give him a tip for us.

Pizza was good, but had the WORST customer service. I ordered ahead online, and I called to confirm it was on it's way and the guy kept hanging up on me.  Finally on my 4th call, I simply said "why do you keep hanging up on me?", and he didn't answer but at least ask questions about my order.  Then, he literally started YELLING at me, saying I didn't tell him that i ordered ahead online. Literally yelling. I was so shocked, I was speechless. Then hung up on me again.  I'm hoping he was just having a bad day and doesn't actually treat customers (or anyone) like that.

WORST SERVICE EVER!!!!
Ordered a pizza and garlic twists, was told it would be delivered 30 to 45 min.
WHAT A JOKE, after an hour and 15 min I called and was told “they were very busy but it just came out of the over and would be delivered in about 10 min., I was his first stop.”   30 min later still no pizza.  Called to see what was going on and they kept hanging up on me. By this time it’s after 9:00 pm and most other pizza places weren’t delivering anymore or weren’t answering their phones.  NO FOOR THAT NIGHT.
WHATEVER YOU DO, DON’T ORDER FROM DOMINOS IN WASHINGTON DC.
WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER HAD!!!!!!

Very good spot on Capitol Hill! Great service. Good choices of lunch food like salads, burgers, and sandwiches plus entrees. I got the Texas burger. Huge burger with fresh ingredients and cooked to my liking. French onion soup was a bit thin but had good cheese and onions. Good local beer selection too.

More upscale Eastern Market location. The outdoor seating is nice. We only ate appetizers here but we've heard the sandwiches are good. It's a good pub style restaurant where you can quickly grab something and enjoy conversations with friends.
DC, 10/2022

We visited Tunnicliff's for brunch with the family and wife's sister. The service was very good. The brunch menu is almost entirely eggs, which is not my jam (but I I am in the minority here). Thankfully, the server said I could order something from the regular menu, which is the main impetus behind the 5 stars.

So, I was able to order a reuben which was not on the menu. It was pretty good and hit the spot.

We have been ordering takeout from here for the last couple years during covid and finally made it in person!

Brunch was delicious!

Some of our other favorites are the buffalo wings, all the burgers, and steak & cheese sandwich.

This was a pretty good place for lunch. I got the buffalo chicken pizza, and my partner got the mac and cheese burger. They were both tasty enough to get again, though neither of them were amazing. Service was good. Overall, I would return again, but it wasn't good enough to become a regular spot.

I was here with my coworkers for team lunch. I really enjoyed the buffet, everything I ate was so good!!!
I recommend if you have a taste for authentic fine Indian & Pakistani tandoori cuisine.

Good Service ✅
Courteous Staff✅

I ordered a dish that is vegetarian at every other restaurant I’ve ever ordered from, off of the veggie section of their menu, and and confirmed it didn’t list meat as an ingredient.

Food arrived and contained Chicken.

Delivery was handled by the restaurant directly, so I can’t even blame a third party service.

Would highly recommend that anyone with dietary restrictions or ingredient preferences never go here because what you order might not be what you get.

Garlic naan was covered in sesame seeds, and tasted sour.  The Somosa was good, but not good enough to make up for everything else.

Avoid. This food, while texturally accurate, is totally tasteless. Its like they created a curry without any of the spices that give it flavor. There was no richness, no wonderful flavor that Indian/Pakistani food should have. I Ordered Karahi Chicken and Palak Paneer - 2 of the easy classics that any Indian restaurant should be able to knock out of the park, and like I said they were both completely tasteless.

I'll never spend money here again.

so good! dont let the 1 star reviews food you. aatish has gone under new management and has really taken a step up. The chicken biryani is my personal favorite, tastes exactly like how they make it in Pakistan. My #1 Favorite indian cuisine to go to. Their decor also reminded me of a cozy family restaurant and it really brought the indian atmosphere to life. Dont understand why people are upset about the rule of one item per customer, Its fairly common especially in D.C? The food is worth it. Ive dined in, taken in, delivered and the results have alwayd been 10/10

Food tasted fresh and authentic. My favorite is the Rogan Josh however their butter chicken and lamb biryani are amazing and the best in DC. Don’t let past reviews fool you as they recently underwent changes and have drastically increased their quality and service. I highly recommend Aatish on the Hill.

True hole in the wall.  I can see why Guy F enjoyed this place.  Ordered the empanana player and was not disappointed.   My wife and two kids enjoyed the visit as well.  The food came out hot and fresh even though it was near closing time.  The setting inside was quaint and was great for my family.  Easy to locate and was conveniently located next the marketplace.  The service was also top notch.  The staff were very friendly and clearly shows they enjoy what they do.  My only opportunity is the need for a better selection of drinks, specifically tea.  But that does not affect my 5 star rating!!!!

Excellent service. The menu is digital, which was off-putting, but overall a good experience. Patio seating was nice, with sun-umbrellas and WiFi. Delicious breakfast with plantains, and they have a wide beverage selection including house made horchata.

Their prices are higher now; whose aren’t? But, this place is still a solid deal on the Hill: one of the last of the affordable and satiating places to eat still left on the hill.  Before the Hill gets even more bougie than it is now, make time to try this place, now, to get a taste of a blue collar meal that will fill you up for the rest of the day! Try the Salvadoran breakfast, or a side of the delicious sweet sautéed plantains, depicted in my photo, or the Mexican breakfast, a breakfast burrito with egg and crumbled chorizo, a seasoned sausage.  As of April, 2022, this wonderful hidden treasure IS OPEN for dining inside, or on their patio seating out front, across from Eastern Market.

This place has great food! I always make it a point to stop by if I'm in town to get a fajita salad with a horchata and I am one happy camper. The price is very reasonable and the staff is super friendly. Love this place

The food is so good.  Authentic.  It has all sorts of great foods to chose from and everything is done right. That's why they were on the food channel.  This is a small spot but theres always room for dessert. The deserts are awesome too. The fresh made juice drinks are to die for and the service can be compared to being treated like family.  This place is love.

We found this place by accident.  What a wonderful little location!  I had super delicious blueberry pancake breakfast.  The coffee was terrific and the waiter was very attentive.  My coffee cup was never empty.

I loved the decor.  Loads of nostalgia along with a wonderful collection of antiques,  fire department gear and heads of stuffed wildlife.  It was fun just looking around at the walls and it's kitschy collections.

I came for the atmosphere; I stayed for the excellent service.  And I do mean really amazing service on a Sunday afternoon in February when this bartender was also covering the ALL of the table service as well!  Unfortunately, they were out of several tap beers, including Guinness, and a few menu items, including collard greens.  The French dip sandwich was decent, but nothing amazing.  The fried mushrooms really hit the spot though. I’ll be back again, maybe later in the year.
Hard to find but well worth it. Historic dive bar with excellent food and great service. Stop in and check it out. The beer was cold and the wings had some heat. Deep fried burger was perfect.

Super friendly service. Great atmosphere. Mozzarella sticks are huge! The breakfast quesadillas are delicious. The burger was great with huge slices of pickle. Recommend giving this place a shot. The pancake was the size of my plate and perfect.

Wonderful atmosphere, and service. Our server, Ricky was great. Told lots of jokes and really made some out of towners feel very welcomed.

The food was okay and felt a bit greasy. To the point that we had to wash our hands after. Would definitely go again. The Mac and cheese wedges were amazing!!!

Very nice location for lunch or breakfast. Our server was very friendly and took care. The food selection is classic but the food itself is very delicious and cooked very well. Nothing to complain and highly recommended if you are in the area. Lots of people where having brunch. Looked also very delicious.

Excellent brunch spot in Capital Hill, great menu selections and kudos to the chef!! Everything was fresh and delicious, Eggs Benedict Florentine and Breakfast Sammie were excellent and we suggest starting with the Cinnamon Rolls and deviled eggs!!! Our server Lisa was very attentive and friendly, as were the other staff who would check in as they passed our table. Will definitely return and recommend!!!!

Absolutely splendid meal from start to finish with attentive and informed service in this warm, dimly lit saloon-style farm-to-table new American restaurant.

We started with a quartet of creamy deviled eggs accented with crispy onion, on a delicious bed of pickled carrot and radish slaw.

Next we shared roasted bone marrow with grilled bread, accompanied by pickled pistachios and for seasoning, some coarse salt. The extraction of the marrow is a bit of an experience but the wait staff are excellent guides so don't feel shy about asking. The reward was worth it, the fatty marrow with a pinch of salt on the bread was everything.

Next was the cucumber and feta salad in a gorgeous green lemon balm emulsion with chive, fennel and benne seeds. Vibrant with cool flavor, it also served as a palette cleanser from the marrow.

For our mains, we split two dishes: the burger and bucatini.

The burger with white cheddar and smoky bacon was perfectly cooked and literally dripping with indulgent flavor, and the fresh lettuce, tomato and onion added balance and texture to each bite.

The bucatini was a savory delight, with a perfectly ground and blended dry pork ragu, accented with chives, garlic chips, and and sarvechhio. It needed nothing more, a fully complete and engaging dish.

We finished the meal with the candy bar dessert, with caramel and chocolate mousse bounded by thin and crunchy shortbread. Heaven.

Throughout, I sipped on a very boozy cocktail called the Ambisinistrous, with bahnez mezcal, rye, campari and foro amoro. Registers like a Boulevardier. Strong but well balanced.

Staff was extremely friendly with collaborative service.

Recommend highly. Can't wait to return.

What a stellar bar/restaurant in Capitol Hill! Good variety of whiskey and wine, delicious craft cocktails, and knowledgeable bartenders. Food was also at a very high level, and the flavors and ingredients were unique and local. Pastas are top notch and the desserts should not be missed. I couldn’t be more satisfied with a meal!

Our first time dining here and we will definitely be back to check out more of their menu. The food and cocktails were amazing (pictured - seared rockfish, roast chicken breast, and lion’s tail cocktail). The only con was that we waited a long time for our drinks, but they noticed before we mentioned anything. Nonetheless, we had a very pleasant experience.

This spot has a lot of character. I was here for a work dinner with a group of people so we had a prix menu. Very limited. The food was bland. The regular food outside our section did look much more colorful and tasty so hopefully it tastes better but I would not recommend it for a group outing. The server was not helpful at all. I asked what the chicken was stuffed with. His reply was “stuffing”. It ended up being stuffed with mushrooms and prosciutto which was fine but the staff should definitely be more informed, especially when assigned to a group with such a limited menu. The chowder was the best part.

Took my boyfriend here and was surprised by how affordable the prices for food and drink were (in comparison to the rest of DC). We visited on a Friday night while Congress was in recess so it was quiet, quick, and romantic. The food was great and definitely would visit again!

We were not crazy about the cookie but everything else was great!  We both got drinks, an entree, and a dessert for around ~$70.

I come here a lot for brunch. We really enjoy the quiet,  easy-going atmosphere, the good is good too. We have had a couple blunders where the cooks do not understand what scrambled eggs cooked well done means, but other than that, it's still one if our favorite places to grab breakfast!

By far, the best chicken tenders and crispy seasoned fries we've had in town. Even my cat was lurking around as soon as we opened the boxes and he's hardly ever interested in human food. Next time, I'd love to stay and dine in the restaurant. It's big, clean, and the food has been great and affordable.

If you’re a gin drinker and like refreshing cocktails, I’d recommend ordering the Basil Beauty. It was made with care by the bartender, who was friendly, yet professional. I was told the Capital Blossom cocktail is also a popular choice, but I didn’t try it this time. For food, I ordered the Patty Melt, subbed fries for chips. Fast service, really delicious food, and the atmosphere was welcoming and relaxed.

Was told by the folks who are Arlington Cemetery guides that this was the place to go for food after my tour...
They were not wrong!  Great meal in a place that may not look like much, but its been part of DC history for a very long time.
My meal was very tasty, hot, and fresh and I feel like I got my monies worth for a change!
Friendly staff and my waitress did a great job.
Loved the Salmon and the brownie treat... yummy

Nightly specials, bar, and all the rest...

Will come back again.

NOTE***
Went back a day later and had another lunch meal.  It was just as good, yummy food.  :)

My boyfriend and I came to visit the DC area and were recommended to visit Mr. Henry’s. As music lovers, we absolutely LOVED the musicians and Dominique Bianco‘s performance! Our server, Pat, was incredibly
sweet and offered a dessert at the end when the food took some time to make (which we didn’t even notice because the jazz show was that good!) I recommend the steak, it was delicious! Mr. Henry’s, we will definitely be back!

Went back for old times sake after 15 years...used to live around-the-corner from it on Capital Hill.  Still same atmosphere but the nachos were not as I remember... too many beans...but their other food was good.  Great neighborhood joint!

Always a great time at Mr. Henry's! They have various jazz themes each day of the week located in the cozy upstairs part of the restaurant. There is a $15 minimum per person which I recommend ordering drinks since the food is fairly mediocre. Also last Saturday there was only 1 server for the entire audience and it took a really long time to get help. Not her fault and I felt bad for her but she handled it with a smile.

I really enjoyed their brunch and waffles.I also enjoyed their mimosas "no ice please."Lol.We visited DC on vacation and truly got more out of this trip than we imagined we would.We will definitely be back in DC and when we do we'll be right back here!

The ladies that work here are the nicest most fab people I have ever met. I walked in needing a large order in 10 min for a special event for my boss and not only did they deliver they went above and beyond! The coffee was great and they even helped me carry everything out to the car. Thank you Syn, Aijah, and your colleague for making our special guest from England feel welcomed and right at home with the tea! Great job connecting with the community! I’ll definitely be back and encourage you all to visit this special neighborhood gem!

So I was completely unaware that there were Starbucks locations that were to-go only. I had a meeting and when I walked in, I asked if I could use the bar area. I noticed there wasn’t any seating, but she allowed me to use the bar area. I was there for at least an hour, then ordered food and drinks. But after a while, I’m assuming the manager told me that I needed to go, that this was to-go only, and that he had let me stay here too long. Yikes!!! I completely understand but I asked when I came in. Lol still a good location but that was awkward

I really wanted to give them a shot but my second visit there was so unpleasant.
I went for the first time to redeem point from my Starbucks reward. The young men told me my merch had to be blow $20 but the cup I wanted was over $20, I asked if I could pay the rest on my card but was told no. So I went to look for a cheaper cup and a different cashier as if I was ordering anything (as in to hurry up and pick somethhing) in a rude tone. I guess I was holding up the line but I wasn't even in line. I told her I was trying to find a cup to redeem with my points with. I felt rushed and just grab a cheap cup to be done with it.
My next visit I went there to buy baked banana bread while I wait for my lyft. A different cashier from before ask if I was ordering if not I had to get out. She said "you need to leave. This is a "to-go store". I didn't know what a to go startbuck was but they said no one can sit in the Cafe, only pick up their oder and leave. If I had known that I wouldn't have went in there to buy anything. The manager wasn't very nice either but I did get my refund. I dont know if the staff are stressed out but someone who is a paying customer shouldn't be told to get out especially if I already paid for an item. I had negative interactions with 4 different staff members, one a manager, in only two visit.

This store is really hit and miss. I realize the below incident might seem petty and silly, but I try to be a good and easygoing customer. I never do things like complain and leave bad reviews, I know the employees are human too. I get the same drink 1 to 3 times a day, I leave $3-5 in the tip jar, all i want is my drink correctly made. Today's experience was just fustrating, especially as Ive just moved to this neighborhood and was really hoping to make this location my "go-to" Starbucks.

Went yesterday and had a decent experience. Came back this morning about 1020am and the woman making drinks was quite rude. My drink was meant to have cold foam on top. First she served it without cold foam. No big deal, I asked her to please fix it. Because she had originally made the drink without cold foam, she had put extra ice in the cup. Instead of pouring the drink into a bigger cup to accommodate the cold foam, she just tried to squeeze a very thin layer on top of the already full cup (which had WAY too much ice). She had also poured my caramel drizzle over the the original drink and didnt add anymore on top of the new cold foam so it was basically lost in the drink. I tried the new drink and apart from the cold foam issue (because she tried to squeeze it in there was about 1/4 the amount thats supposed to be included) it was pretty obvious she had also forgotten the flavored syrup that was supposed to be in this drink. I get this drink 1-3 times a day, everyday. I know what its supposed to taste like. When I asked, "is the syrup in here" she very rudely responded "if its listed on the sticker then its in the cup". Crazy response but she had quite literally just missed on of the items listed on the sticker.... i ended up throwing the whole drink away because her attitude seemed very annoyed and i didnt trust her to not mess with the drink if i got it remade. Extremely fustrating and a waste of my money. Management needs to do better training employees. Trying to squeeze in the cold foam instead of taking 10 seconds to pour into a bigger cup and then her response? Just really not acceptable.
This is a clean and well-run Starbucks. The employees are really nice and my coffee always comes out promptly.

This restaurant is amazing! The atmosphere is perfect, the people are super nice and pleasant,  and the food is out of this world delicious! We got excellent service from Luis...ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and tortellini with meat. Also, fried calamari as an appetizer and tried the pomegranate martini. Everything was prepared perfectly and squeezed in canoli for dessert!  This is my second time here while in town and will definitely be back. Five stars!

My wife and I love Italian food and wanted to try something new and this restaurant did not disappoint. We showed up on a Saturday night and was seated quickly. Our waiter Manuel was very attentive and food came out fast. The food and drinks were very good.  Definitely a great place for a date night. Highly recommend this restaurant for authentic Italian food.

Wanted to have some amazing carbs before I transition to over to whole 30. Came by this establishment but no reservations but was able to receive a seat immediately. Service was very quick. Appetizers as well as the meal came out quickly. Atmosphere is kind of dim. It could be a little tight I feel like a lot of the tables are really close to each other. There is no front desk person so you literally walk in and whoever sees you first helps you get arranged and seated. I would definitely recommend this place.

I went to this trattoria because it was in the neighborhood where I grew up. I had a very enjoyable conversation with Ernie Buruca, the bartender.  Ernie is a very good Barcologist. For those that are not aware of what a Barcologist is, it's a bartender/psychologist. I had a very pleasant conversation that went from drinks, children, adult children, politics and government. Ernie was on point the whole time. Great job Ernie. Now the food 😋.  The seafood linguine was outstanding. It had more than enough seafood to compliment the linguine. It was well prepared well seasoned. It's rare that you get the good seafood - spice blend 😋.  It could be considered pricey by some, but remember you get what you pay for. It is well worth it. I ordered both white wine sauce and marinara. Both were great. I also ordered two additional entrees. All was to go. If you get your food and drive 20 miles and your food hasn't dried out or gotten soggy, and is still wonderful, the you have found a gem. I will rate the other entrees later. I need a nap.
UPDATE: Okay I had my nap from eating all that wonderful seafood. Now the veal and chicken parmigan (two separate orders), were wonderful. I have had them with the veal or chicken patty was over cooked and dry. This was not the case. The veal and chicken were moist and didn't need to be drowned in sauce as is the case when it is over cooked. There was enough sauce and cheese to accentuate the flavor of the meat.
Lastly, the presentation was outstanding. Look at the photo of seafood linguine. Great Job!!

I’ve lived in DC for three years now and feel confident in saying Trattoria Alberto has the best Italian food in DC.

It has great service and great drinks as well. I recommend the cucumber martini and the fiocchi for an entree, but every pasta dish I’ve had has been exceptional. The fish specials are also always cooked perfectly. Honestly, I’d eat here every day if I could afford it.

I’ve had dinner here maybe ten times and each time our experience has been stellar. The one time our food was slightly delayed the owner gave us all a complementary glass of wine— appreciated but unnecessary!
